1: A song of ascents. Viciously have they attacked me from my youth, let Israel say now.
2: Viciously have they attacked me from my youth, yet they have not prevailed against me.
3: Upon my back the plowers plowed, as they traced their long furrows.
4: But the just Lord cut me free from the ropes of the wicked.[b]
5: May they recoil in disgrace, all who hate Zion.
6: May they be like grass on the rooftops[c] withered in early growth,
7: Never to fill the reaper's hands, nor the arms of the binders of sheaves,
8: And with none passing by to call out: “The blessing of the Lord be upon you![d] We bless you in the name of the Lord!”
